Module com.cyte.edamame
Package com.cyte.edamame

Class EDAmameController

java.lang.Object
com.cyte.edamame.EDAmameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class EDAmameController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Main Controller for the EDAmame Application.

Implements all general functionality that is not delegated to an editor or other sub-module. Actions such as creating, opening, closing librarys, projects and files is handled by this controller.

Author:
Jeff Wiegley, Ph.D., jeffrey.wiegley@gmail.com

  • Field Details

    • Controller_Logger

      private static final Logger Controller_Logger
      The logger for the entire application. All classes/modules should obtain and use this static logger.

    • Controller_Stage

      private final javafx.Controller_Stage.Stage Controller_Stage
      The Controller_Stage hosting this controller.

    • Controller_Editors

      private final javafx.collections.ObservableMap<javafx.scene.control.Tab,Editor> Controller_Editors
      All Controller_Editors instantiated are remembered in a HashMap for fast lookup keyed by their main Editor_Tab.

    • Controller_TabLog

      private javafx.scene.control.Tab Controller_TabLog
      The Editor_Tab used to hold the TextArea used for application logging.

    • Controller_LogText

      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea Controller_LogText
      The TextArea to display logged information on

    • Controller_SplitPane

      private javafx.scene.control.SplitPane Controller_SplitPane
      The main split pane separating always available global controls on the left from editor Editor_Tabs on right.

    • Controller_StackPaneControls

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane Controller_StackPaneControls
      The stack pane on left of split used to contain different control setups.

    • Controller_TabPaneControls

      private javafx.scene.control.TabPane Controller_TabPaneControls
      the TabPane used to hold all the main controls. Displayed in the "navigation" pane of the controls stack.

    • Controller_TabPane

      private javafx.scene.control.TabPane Controller_TabPane
      primary TabPane displayed on the right of split used by EDAmame to present Controller_Editors and information.

    • Controller_StackPaneEditorToolBars

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane Controller_StackPaneEditorToolBars
      A stack of toolbars to the right of the main EDAmame toolbar. Editors can provide own toolbars for here.

    • Controller_MenuBar

      private javafx.scene.control.MenuBar Controller_MenuBar
      The main EDAmame menu bar

    • Controller_MenuLogItem

      private javafx.scene.control.MenuItem Controller_MenuLogItem
      the menu item for toggling log visibility.

  • Constructor Details

    • EDAmameController

      public EDAmameController(javafx.Controller_Stage.Stage Controller_Stage)
      Constructs an instance of this controller with knowledge of the Controller_Stage that it is attached to. Knowledge of the Controller_Stage allows the controller to entirely take control of proper closing activities even when its an onCloseRequest generated by a user killing the application of an operating system's "close" window decoration.
      Parameters:
      Controller_Stage - The Controller_Stage that is hosting/using this controller.

  • Method Details

    • Controller_ExecuteOnShown

      private void Controller_ExecuteOnShown()
      Execute activites required to be done once the main Application Controller_Stage is finally shown. (Activities performed in the initialize(URL, ResourceBundle) happen before the various scene nodes have been sized, laid out, and rendered. This provides a location to perform all startup tasks required but unsuitable for standard initialization.

    • Controller_DividerRestore

      private void Controller_DividerRestore()
      Restores the main split pane's divider position between runs of the application.

      The application establishes a main look and feel that consists of a split pane containing two nodes. The left node is used to contain to level controls specific to the entire EDAmame application. The right pane is a Editor_Tab pane that provides tabbed locations for Controller_Editors and other sub-modules to place their controls. The user's selection of divider position is maintained between runs of the application.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      JavaFX Controller_Stage initialization procedures
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • Controller_LoggingChangeToTab

      private void Controller_LoggingChangeToTab()
      Change the log handler for the package wide logger from stdout to a TextArea node. EDAmame has a dedicated Editor_Tab for displaying log information. Controller_LoggingChangeToTab removes all log handlers from the logger and replaces them with a handler that appends requested logging information to a TextArea in the dedicated log Editor_Tab.

    • Controller_Exit

      private void Controller_Exit()
      Controller_Exit() implements graceful and intelligent shutdown of the EDAmame application. All open Controller_Editors will be requested to perform their close/save/shutdown activities and the EDAmame application will exit gracefully. This action is triggered by menu items or On Close Request.

    • Controller_WindowContextSave

      private void Controller_WindowContextSave()
      Saves the window position and size of the application as Java Preferences. The values of the size and position of the application are saved to the Java Preference storage. User preferences and settings for application behavior are stored in YAML files to avoid overly complicating platform dependent stores such as registries.

    • Controller_WindowContextLoad

      private void Controller_WindowContextLoad()
      Restores the window position and size of the application. The values of the size and position of the application when this context was last saved is restored. Context is typically saved when the application exits gracefully.

    • Editor_EnableSelect

      private void Editor_EnableSelect()
      Enables to controller logic for switching between editor Editor_Tabs. Editors are composed of several nodes. A single main editor Editor_Tab that is always visible in editorTabPane. A set of control Editor_Tabs that are only present/visible in the Controller_TabPaneControls when the editor is selected. A Editor_ToolBar that is only visible in the Editor_ToolBar area when the editor is selected. A set of Editor_Menus and items that are only present in the Editor_Menus when the editor is selected. Editor_EnableSelect provides the control for the presence and visibility of these items based on Editor_Tab selection. When a Editor_Tab is selected the UI components for the previously selected editor are removed/hidden and the components for the newly selected editor are enabled/shown.

    • Editor_Activate

      private void Editor_Activate(Editor editor)
      Symbol Libraries, Footprint Libraries, Schematics, PCBs are all handled by their own Controller_Editors. Editors supply their own controllers and controls. The EDAmameController folds these controls into its own Editor_Menus, toolbars and windows by obtaining, reparenting and controlling the visibility of those controls. Editors are activated by EDAmame by making sure that only the selected Editor_Tab's controls are visible and accessible.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to make controls visible for.

    • Editor_Deactivate

      private void Editor_Deactivate(Editor editor)
      Editors are deactivated by EDAmame by making sure that unselected editor Editor_Tabs' controls are invisible and inaccessible.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to make controls invisible for.

    • Editor_Add

      private void Editor_Add(Editor editor)
      Editors are added by EDAmame by including their menu items and toolbars in its Editor_Menus and toolbar areas.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to setup and add controls for. They all start out invisible/unavailable.

    • Editor_Remove

      private void Editor_Remove(Editor editor)
      Editors are removed by EDAmame by removing their menu items and toolbars in its Editor_Menus and toolbar areas. This should really only be done once an editor has been closed and has no need to save data.
      Parameters:
      editor - Which editor to remove controls for.

    • Controller_LogClear

      protected void Controller_LogClear()
      A simple event handle to clear the TextArea/Pane where logging happens.

    • Controller_LogToggleVisibility

      private void Controller_LogToggleVisibility()
      The log Editor_Tab can be made visible or not. It is always the right most Editor_Tab of all Editor_Tabs. When explicitly added the log Editor_Tab is automatically selected.

    • Controller_LogToggleItemText

      private void Controller_LogToggleItemText()
      Simple function to correct the textual information present on the menu item for toggling the state of the log window.

    • Controller_NavigationTabPaneSelect

      private void Controller_NavigationTabPaneSelect()
      Select the "navigation" pane is the main controls to show. The left element of the main split pane is a global controls area and is designed to support future features. It is a stacked pane containing as many controls as needed by EDAmame development. The primary control is a Editor_Tab pane. Editors add their controls into this Editor_Tab pane as additional Editor_Tabs. This primary Editor_Tab pane control is called the "Navigation" Pane.

    • onTestButtonClick

      protected void onTestButtonClick()
      A test method for a test button to add a fake editor to the page to verify concept.

    • onTestButtonClickDatabase

      protected void onTestButtonClickDatabase()
      A test method for checking database connectivity.
